description:
The clickable, interactive part of the slider.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Slider](https://base-ui.com/react/components/slider)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

description:
Visualizes the current value of the slider.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Slider](https://base-ui.com/react/components/slider)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

description:
Groups all parts of the slider.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Slider](https://base-ui.com/react/components/slider)

defaultValue.description:
The uncontrolled value of the slider when it’s initially rendered.

To render a controlled slider, use the `value` prop instead.
defaultValue.name: defaultValue

disabled.description: Whether the slider should ignore user interaction.
disabled.name: disabled

format.description: Options to format the input value.
format.name: format

locale.description:
The locale used by `Intl.NumberFormat` when formatting the value.
Defaults to the user's runtime locale.
locale.name: locale

max.description:
The maximum allowed value of the slider.
Should not be equal to min.
max.name: max

min.description:
The minimum allowed value of the slider.
Should not be equal to max.
min.name: min

minStepsBetweenValues.description: The minimum steps between values in a range slider.
minStepsBetweenValues.name: minStepsBetweenValues

name.description: Identifies the field when a form is submitted.
name.name: name

step.description:
The granularity with which the slider can step through values. (A "discrete" slider.)
The `min` prop serves as the origin for the valid values.
We recommend (max - min) to be evenly divisible by the step.
step.name: step

largeStep.description: The granularity with which the slider can step through values when using Page Up/Page Down or Shift + Arrow Up/Arrow Down.
largeStep.name: largeStep

thumbAlignment.description:
How the thumb(s) are aligned relative to `Slider.Control` when the value is at `min` or `max`:
- `center`: The center of the thumb is aligned with the control edge
- `edge`: The thumb is inset within the control such that its edge is aligned with the control edge
- `edge-client-only`: Same as `edge` but renders after React hydration on the client, reducing bundle size in return
thumbAlignment.name: thumbAlignment

thumbCollisionBehavior.description:
Controls how thumbs behave when they collide during pointer interactions.

- `'push'` (default): Thumbs push each other without restoring their previous positions when dragged back.
- `'swap'`: Thumbs swap places when dragged past each other.
- `'none'`: Thumbs cannot move past each other; excess movement is ignored.
thumbCollisionBehavior.name: thumbCollisionBehavior

value.description:
The value of the slider.
For ranged sliders, provide an array with two values.
value.name: value

onValueChange.description:
Callback function that is fired when the slider's value changed.
You can pull out the new value by accessing `event.target.value` (any).

The `eventDetails.reason` indicates what triggered the change:

- `'input-change'` when the hidden range input emits a change event (for example, via form integration)
- `'track-press'` when the control track is pressed
- `'drag'` while dragging a thumb
- `'keyboard'` for keyboard input
- `'none'` when the change is triggered without a specific interaction
onValueChange.name: onValueChange

type.name: (value: Value extends number ? number : Value, eventDetails: SliderRootChangeEventDetails) => void

onValueCommitted.description:
Callback function that is fired when the `pointerup` is triggered.
**Warning**: This is a generic event not a change event.

The `eventDetails.reason` indicates what triggered the commit:

- `'drag'` while dragging a thumb
- `'track-press'` when the control track is pressed
- `'keyboard'` for keyboard input
- `'input-change'` when the hidden range input emits a change event (for example, via form integration)
- `'none'` when the commit occurs without a specific interaction
onValueCommitted.name: onValueCommitted

type.name: (value: Value extends number ? number : Value, eventDetails: SliderRootCommitEventDetails) => void

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

description:
The draggable part of the slider at the tip of the indicator.
Renders a `<div>` element and a nested `<input type="range">`.

Documentation: [Base UI Slider](https://base-ui.com/react/components/slider)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

tabIndex.description: Optional tab index attribute forwarded to the `input`.
tabIndex.name: tabIndex

onFocus.description: A focus handler forwarded to the `input`.
onFocus.name: onFocus

onBlur.description: A blur handler forwarded to the `input`.
onBlur.name: onBlur

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

index.description:
The index of the thumb which corresponds to the index of its value in the
`value` or `defaultValue` array.
This prop is required to support server-side rendering for range sliders
with multiple thumbs.
@example ```tsx
<Slider.Root value={[10, 20]}>
  <Slider.Thumb index={0} />
  <Slider.Thumb index={1} />
</Slider.Root>
```
index.name: index

disabled.description: Whether the thumb should ignore user interaction.
disabled.name: disabled

inputRef.description: A ref to access the nested input element.
inputRef.name: inputRef

getAriaValueText.description:
A function which returns a string value for the [`aria-valuetext`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-valuetext) attribute of the `input`.
This is important for screen reader users.
getAriaValueText.name: getAriaValueText

type.name: (formattedValue: string, value: number, index: number) => string

getAriaLabel.description: A function which returns a string value for the [`aria-label`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-label) attribute of the `input`.
getAriaLabel.name: getAriaLabel

description:
Contains the slider indicator and represents the entire range of the slider.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Slider](https://base-ui.com/react/components/slider)
